strategy.title: Dust II Casual Armory Pass Strategy

sections.heading: What’s the Strategy?
sections.content: Use an SMG-only tactic: Players should purchase a P90; if they can’t afford it, they can opt for a PP-Bizon. As CTs, focus on pushing mid; as Ts, aim for top mid by moving towards the barrel in top middle.

sections.heading: How Does the Round System Work?
sections.content: Balanced Rounds: The goal is to maintain a tied score of 7:7. The winning team should allow the losing team to win by locating enemies and letting them shoot you.

sections.heading: Why Aim for 7:7?
sections.content: Ensuring Fair Scores: In Casual mode, a score of 7:7 ensures that all players can earn the minimum score for Armory Pass tokens. This helps prevent any team from gaining an early advantage.

sections.heading: How Long Does the Game Take?
sections.content: Each round lasts about 30 seconds, meaning that with 30 rounds, the total match time is approximately 7.5 minutes.

sections.heading: How Many Kills for the Armory Pass?
sections.content: Score Requirement: To earn tokens, you need at least 40 points. Scoring over 52+ is considered excessive and may lead to being kicked by teammates. Try to keep your score under 45, as higher scores do not yield more stars.

sections.heading: Does Reduced XP Affect Armory Pass Tokens?
sections.content: Not at all! Your Armory Pass tokens are based on your in-game statistics, not your XP.

sections.heading: How to Easily Find a Lobby
sections.content: If you’re not having trouble finding lobbies, you can skip this step! To find a lobby, you’ll need software to block servers according to your preferences. Follow these steps: 1. Download the tool from CS2 Server Picker [ https://github.com/FN-FAL113/cs2-server-picker/releases/tag/v2.2.3 ]. 2. Extract the files. 3. Close CS2 if it’s running. 4. Open the CS2ServerPicker application. 5. Block all servers. 6. Unblock only those in China.
